Count reads in a library like HTSeq

Source: R/BamFunctions.R
countLibrary.Rd

This function creates a granges object from the txdb and calls countReadsInRanges. Uses for this function may be during QC to generate log2cpm over the CDS regions in protein coding transcriptome, for example

countLibrary(
  bam_path,
  annote_db,
  feature_type,
  strandedness,
  num_threads = 1,
  single_end_reads_flag = TRUE,
  mapq_filter = 20L
)

Arguments

bam_path

path to a bam file. the index must also exist
annote_db

txdb object. see makeTxDbFromGFF
feature_type

one of c("exon", "cds"). Determines what feature to count over
strandedness

strandedness of library determined by protocol. One of c("reverse", "same", "unstranded") reverse means the counted reads will be on the opposite strand of the feature, same means they will be on the same strand. unstranded counts reads over the feature regardless of strand
num_threads

number of threads available for parallelization. Default to 1
single_end_reads_flag

whether or not the library is single or paired. Note: this is not written to deal with paired end reads currently, though you can try
mapq_filter

quality filter on read alignment. Default to 20, same as HTSeq. see https://htseq.readthedocs.io/en/release_0.11.1/count.html

Value

A RangedSummarizedExperiment. See summarizeOverlaps

See also

http://achri.blogspot.com/2016/02/how-not-to-use-deseq2-for-illumina.html, https://htseq.readthedocs.io/en/release_0.11.1/count.html, summarizeOverlaps

Examples

if (FALSE) library(brentlabRnaSeqTools)
library(AnnotationDbi)

kn99_db = loadDb("data/kn99_db.sqlite")

#> Error in dbFileConnect(file): DB file 'data/kn99_db.sqlite' not found

combined_df = getMetadata(database_info$kn99_host,
                          database_info$kn99_db_name,
                          Sys.getenv("db_username"),
                          Sys.getenv("password"))

#> Error: fe_sendauth: no password supplied

run_5102 = combined_df %>%
 filter(runNumber == 5102,
        experimentDesign == '90minuteInduction',
        genotype1 == "CNAG_00000")

#> Error in filter(., runNumber == 5102, experimentDesign == "90minuteInduction",     genotype1 == "CNAG_00000"): object 'combined_df' not found

wt_fastq = run_5102[[1, 'fastqFileName']]

#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'run_5102' not found

bam_path = createBamPath(5102,
                         wt_fastq,
                         align_expr_prefix =
                         "/mnt/htcf_scratch/chasem/rnaseq_pipeline/align_count_results")

#> Error in basename(fastq_filename): object 'wt_fastq' not found

cds_count = countLibrary(bam_path, kn99_db, 'cds', 'reverse', 8)

#> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'cdsBy': object 'kn99_db' not found

cds_counts_df = as_tibble(assay(cds_counts), rownames = "gene_name")

#> Error in assay(cds_counts): could not find function "assay"
